result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Concurrent with: **08-14-15/Order amending JOC to reflect ZERO days of sentence credit as to this count**
*9/18/2015  Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit of 24 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Tina M.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerrold Jermaine Hunter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 9/18/2015:  JOC shall be amended to reflect that sentence on count one is concurrent with any other sentence.  Further ordered that  JOC shall be amended to reflect 24 days of sentence credit on count one.
Decision and Order Granting Request to Amend Judgment of Conviction filed and signed by the Court.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request for amended JOC.
Order Vacating Credit filed and signed by the Court.  The Judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect ZERO days of sentence credit on count one in case 15CF441. Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of sentence credit.

Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 15 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 128 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Tina M.
*Seek and maintain Full-time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Restitution is set at $0 (zero).


- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Appeal rights given.    

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Order to Produce for Sentncing Hearing on July 10, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court.  Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Sentencing hearing.  Defendant not produced for today's proceedings.   Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Department Officer Allison Cerqua.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  
Defendant Jerrold Jermaine Hunter in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
